citation.article-title: Acidocella aluminiidurans sp. nov., an aluminium-tolerant bacterium isolated from Panicum repens grown in a highly acidic swamp in actual acid sulfate soil area of Vietnam
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Acidocella aluminiidurans sp. nov.

Acidocella aluminiidurans [a.lu.mi.ni.i.du′rans. N.L. n. aluminium (from L. n. alumen alum) aluminium; L. part. adj. durans enduring, being insensible; N.L. part. adj. aluminiidurans aluminium-tolerant].
Gram-negative, strictly aerobic, non-spore-forming, non-motile rods (0.3×1.2–1.6 μm).
Colonies are smooth, round, convex and white on 1/10 TS agar plates.
Growth occurs at 17–42 °C but not at 5 or 45 °C.
The pH range for growth is 3.0–7.0 with optimum growth at pH 4–5.
Growth occurs on MT medium (pH 4.0) containing 500 mM aluminium sulfate or 200 mM aluminium chloride.
Physiological characteristics are summarized in Table 1.
The predominant cellular fatty acids are cyclopropyl C19 : 0 and C18 : 1.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 65.6 mol%.
The type strain, AL46T (=NBRC 104303T =VTCC-D9-1T), was isolated from Panicum repens inhabiting an acidic swamp in an AASS area in Vietnam.
